articles.author: Laura Forman
articles.title: Summer Vacationers Want to Kick It Old School
articles.description: Hotels and online travel agents that book them are making a comeback as the world gets closer to normal
articles.content: The new and the high tech are suddenly out of fashion, with the Nasdaq down around 23% this year. That sentiment change seems to have bled into the online travel sector, where the uncool is making a … [+4103 chars]

articles.author: Nicole Nguyen
articles.title: Free Streaming Movies and TV: Good, but Not Too Good to Be True
articles.description: Ad-supported services such as Peacock, Roku Channel and Tubi are budget-minded alternatives to Netflix and Hulu. If you can’t stand commercials, grab your library card.
articles.content:
Im watching commercials again. 
Its been years since I quit cable TV and switched to ad-free streamers such as Netflix. But now, with creeping prices and subscription fatigue setting in, Ive pruned … [+153 chars]

articles.title: Silicon Valley Investors Give Startups Survival Advice for Downturn
articles.description: After years of funneling cash into startups’ grand ambitions, venture-capture firms are telling portfolio companies to buckle down for the long haul.
articles.content:
After years of funneling cash into startups grand ambitions, Silicon Valley investors are engaging in the grim ritual of delivering survival advice to their portfolio companies.

articles.author: Bob Tita | Photographs by Sergio Flores for The Wall Street Journal
articles.title: Robots Pick Up More Work at Busy Factories
articles.description: Rising wages and worker shortages, compounded by increases in Covid-19-related absenteeism, are changing some manufacturers’ attitudes about the use of robots.
articles.content:
Robots are turning up on more factory floors and assembly lines as companies struggle to hire enough workers to fill rising orders.
Orders for workplace robots in the U.S. increased by a record 40% … [+280 chars]

articles.title: Baby-Formula Shortage Worsened by Drop in Breast-Feeding Rates
articles.description: Covid-19 restrictions and pandemic disruptions caused a shift in the way parents feed their babies, according to health experts.
